answers.answer: Hello, there!There is no direct correlation of recurrent skin infections and early HIV infection.  There might be a link in the late stages of HIV when the immune system has been severely affected, which would certainly not be your case. Have you been tested for diabetes? There is certainly a direct relationship of this condition and recurrent boils, cellulitis, etc.Even though HIV infection would be highly unlikely, you definiteily should be tested for HIV because you had unprotected intercourse, during which you contracted genital herpes, and in presence of a herpetic outbreak, the risk of HIV transmission is increased.Best wishes,Dr Jose Gonzalez-Garcia

question: Are skin infections and HIV correlated?I am hsv-2 (genital herpes) positive by the way.I develop infections of the skin fairly easily, since 2006.  Usually MRSA, cellulites, and abscesses… my last HIV screening was during 10.2008 (negative).  I have been able to recover from these infections without complications.  are my skin outbreaks caused by HIV?i WAS having UNPROTECTED sex after 10.2008... with my ex-girlfriend, who gave me herpes.  we're broken up as of late early November 2009.  I have no idea where she is at the moment.I will be tested once i hit my (3rd-4th) month mark of abstinence.   thanks, i appreciate it.
